metadata.title: CVE-2023-52470 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:drm/radeon: check the alloc_workqueue return value in radeon_crtc_init()check the alloc_workqueue return value in radeon_crtc_init() to avoidnull-ptr-deref.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-52470` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic-lpae - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-extra-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-258-generic - 4.4.0-258.292~14.04.2
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-258-generic - 4.4.0-258.292~14.04.2
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-258-lowlatency - 4.4.0-258.292~14.04.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1135-aws - 4.4.0-1135.141
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1180-azure - 4.15.0-1180.195~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.11.0-12.19').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-258.292~14.04.2').
linux-aws package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1135.141').
linux-azure package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1180.195~14.04.1').
